description: [InfoWire] If you've ever played a round of blackjack online, you probably already get the appeal. It's one of those games that somehow never gets old. Whether you're just starting out or you've been playing for years, blackjack keeps things interesting. Unlike many other casino games that rely purely on luck, this one actually gives you a say in how things turn out. When to hit, when to stay your choices matter. That extra layer of strategy adds excitement. And let's be honest, being able to play
title: Africa: Why Online Blackjack is Such a Fan Favorite

description: [African Union] Amb. Amr Aljowaily Director of the Citizens and Diaspora Directorate (CIDO) of the African Union Commission delivered a video recorded message to the Official Launch Ceremony of the 2nd AFROMADRID 2025 World Conference held on June 11th at 12:00 PM in the Assembly Hall of the Ministry of Equality of the Kingdom of Spain.
title: Africa: Official Launch Ceremony of the 2nd Afromadrid 2025 World Conference

description: [African Union] Chairperson of the AU Commission H.E. Mahmoud Ali Youssouf met with the UN High Commissioner for Refugees, H.E. Filippo Grandi this morning . They exchanged views on the regional displacement context &amp; reaffirmed the imperative for coherent &amp; coordinated regional &amp; international responses. The Chairperson welcomed UNHCR's continued partnership with the AU. They both underscored the importance of development-driven, sustainable approaches that empower displaced populations &amp; promote
title: Africa: AUC Chairperson Met With the UN High Commissioner for Refugees, H.E. Filippo Grandi

description: [ISS] Without enough capital or enabling global policy, expecting Africa to decouple economic growth from carbon emissions is a pipe dream.
title: Africa: Africa's Decarbonisation Dilemma

description: [UNHCR] DAKAR, 12 JUNE 2025 - The number of people forcibly displaced or stateless across West and Central Africa has reached a record 12.7 million, reflecting a 48 per cent increase since 2020. Among them are 8.2 million internally displaced people, 2.9 million refugees and asylum-seekers, and nearly 1million stateless individuals, according to new data released by UNHCR, the UN Refugee Agency.
title: Africa: UNHCR Highlights Forced Displacement Trends, Protection Risks, and Solutions in West and Central Africa

description: [The New Humanitarian] London -- What lessons can be learned from Lebanon's displacement crisis?
title: Africa: How to Centre Mental Health in Displacement

description: [World Bank] Washington -- The World Bank has approved $150 million for the Gabon Urban Development project (in French: "Projet d'aménagement et de développement des Infrastructures du Gabon (PADIG)") to enhance access to climate-resilient urban infrastructure and public facilities, and to mitigate flood risks in selected secondary cities.
title: Africa: New Project Improves Urban Infrastructure and Reduces Flood Risk in Gabon's Secondary Cities

description: [Daily Trust] President Donald Trump ordered active-duty US Marines and 2,000 more National Guard troops into Los Angeles on Monday, vowing those protesting immigration arrests would be "hit harder" than ever.
title: Africa: Deportation - Trump Deploys Marines, Vows to Hit Protesters Harder

description: [Daily Trust] The second post-FOCAC Abuja Forum aims to advance China-Africa Modernisation, according to Professor Sheriff Ghali Ibrahim, Director of the Centre for Contemporary China-Africa Research in Nigeria.
title: Africa: '2nd Post-Focac Forum to Advance China-Africa Modernisation'

description: [Liberian Observer] A Liberian delegation led by Assistant Minister for Tourism, Atty. Dogba K. Norris, Jr., has departed Monrovia to participate in two high-level African tourism events in Abuja, Nigeria, aimed at advancing regional collaboration and sustainable tourism practices across the continent.
title: Africa: Liberia Engages Africa's Tourism Leaders in Abuja

description: [Nile Post] In a decisive step toward regional cohesion, the Executive Secretary of the Intergovernmental Authority on Development (IGAD), H.E. Dr. Workneh Gebeyehu, met with the Chairperson of the African Union, H.E. Mahmoud Ali Youssouf, in Addis Ababa today.
title: Africa: IGAD, AU Chiefs Meet in Addis to Bolster Peace and Regional Integration Amid Sudan Crisis

description: [GraÃ§a Machel Trust] "God did not make a mistake by enriching Africa with so many resources. Mozambique and the rest of Africa's energy future holds immense promise. Yet it cannot, and must not, be charted without the full and equitable participation of women--as consumers, as entrepreneurs, as investors, as decisionmakers and as innovators. The energy solutions we pursue must reflect the diverse realities and aspirations of women across the country." HE Graça Machel addressed the 2025 GMT Women in Clean Energy and
title: Africa: 'God Did Not Make a Mistake By Putting Natural Resources in Africa, It's Time for Us to Take Ownership of What We Have' Graça Machel Challenges Women to Participate in the Energy Sector

description: [IPS] Nice, France -- Just before dawn, the worn wooden dhows begin gliding toward the shore at Magogoni fish market in Tanzania's port city of Dar es Salaam. Their tattered sails flutter against the orange sky. Exhausted fishers step out onto the muddy sand, hauling frayed nets and plastic crates, their sun-creased faces tight with fatigue.
title: Africa: UNOC3 - a Cry for Global Action to Save Small-Scale Fisheries

description: [IPS] Nice, France -- As the sun peeked through the French Riviera clouds and a dozen reporters sipped orange juice aboard the WWF Panda Boat docked at Port Lympia, Frankie Orona, a Native American rights advocate from the Society of Native Nations in San Antonio, Texas, stunned the room into a moment of absolute stillness.
title: Africa: 'A Wake-Up Call From the Womb' - Indigenous People Rally for a Binding Plastics Treaty

description: [UN News] With 13.5 million people displaced by over 13 years of brutal civil conflict, Syria used to represent the largest displacement crisis in the world. This is no longer the case.
title: Africa: Displacement Doubles While Funding Shrinks, Warns UNHCR

description: [UNHCR] The number of people displaced by war, violence and persecution worldwide is untenably high, particularly as humanitarian funding evaporates, with the only bright spot being a pickup in returns, notably to Syria, UNHCR, the UN Refugee Agency, said today.
title: Africa: Number of People Uprooted by War at Shocking, Decade-High Levels - UNHCR

description: [IPS] Oslo, Norway -- The world is experiencing a surge in violence not seen since the post-World War II era. 2024 marked a grim new record: the highest number of state-based armed conflicts in over seven decades.
title: Africa: Military Conflicts At Historic High As U.S. Signals Retreat From World Stage

description: [allAfrica]
title: Africa: All of Africa Today - June 12, 2025

description: [DW] The US military is urging African countries to be more responsible for their own security as the Trump administration focuses on domestic policies. Could the move fuel militant groups and undo counterterrorism progress?
title: Africa: U.S. Shifts Africa Security Strategy Amid Global Pivot

description: [allAfrica] A decade after the adoption of the 2030 agenda, a measly 17% of the Sustainable Development Goals, or SDGs, are on track. If we were in a classroom, the international community would fall into the category of "ungraded." This is devastating, but unsurprising: a huge financing gap stands in the way of achieving the Goals. In Africa, an additional $1.3 trillion in financing is needed every year to achieve the SDGs by 2030 - a figure that represents about 42 percent of the
title: Africa: Unlocking Africa's Future - The Imperative of Domestic Resource Mobilization

description: [AI London] One year to go until the largest-ever sporting event across the USA, Canada and Mexico
title: Africa: World Cup 2026 - Growing Threats to Human Rights Set to Undermine FIFA's Responsibilities One Year Out From Kick Off

description: [World Bank] 2025 Growth Forecasts Cut for 70 Percent of Economies
title: Africa: Global Economy Set for Weakest Run Since 2008 Outside of Recessions

description: [IPS] United Nations -- On June 10, the United Nations (UN) held a conference titled Artificial Intelligence for Inclusion: Strengthening Workforce Participation for Persons with Disabilities. This conference, which was organized by the Permanent Mission of Canada to the UN, featured a discussion by a panel of experts from various sectors, looking to shed light on the ways AI tools can be used to create inclusive workforces that maximize fairness and accessibility.
title: Africa: Artificial Intelligence Presents Risks and Opportunities for the Disabled

description: [Global Press Journal] Harare, Zimbabwe -- US aid helped save and sustain lives, but failed to build lasting prosperity. Now, the money's gone. Can Zimbabwe become self-sufficient, or will it turn to China?
title: Africa: A Fragile State - Zimbabwe Reckons With the Catastrophic Loss of Us Aid

description: [IPS] Rome -- Kaveh Zahedi is the Director of the Office of Climate Change, Biodiversity and Environment at the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)
title: Africa: Beating Plastic Pollution in Our Food Systems

description: [UN News] At the Third UN Ocean Conference in Nice, the "catch of the day" wasn't a seabass or a red mullet - it was a figure: 35 per cent. That's the share of global fish stocks now being harvested unsustainably, according to a new UN report released Wednesday.
title: Africa: 'Plenty of Fish in the Sea'? Not Anymore, Say UN Experts in Nice

description: [The Conversation Africa] A new report from the International Labour Organisation outlines a set of propositions on how countries should go about formalising the informal economy. The report provides the basis for negotiations on the subject at the International Labour Conference in Geneva in June 2025.
title: Africa: Waste Pickers and Vendors Should Be Treated As Workers, Not Small Businesses - Labour Lawyer

description: [The Conversation Africa] Women in Africa are often framed as especially vulnerable to climate change. Our earlier research suggested that women entrepreneurs often face a "triple differential vulnerability" to climate risk compared to men.
title: Africa: African Women Entrepreneurs Are a Smart Bet for Climate Change Investment - Research Shows Why

description: [Chatham House] Evidence from conflict economies in the Middle East and Africa
title: Africa: Why Peacebuilding Fails and What to Do About It

description: [Lesotho Times] THE World Health Organization (WHO) is urging countries to maintain vigilance as COVID-19 continues to circulate worldwide, presenting ongoing challenges to public health.
title: Africa: WHOCautions Covid-19 Remains a Global Threat
